title: Instructional Design Expert Training Course for Medical Continuing Education (CME) and EPA Development

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Knowledge in Medical Education Design and Experience with Project-Based Learning
context.additional_context: Collaboration platform-based instruction using digital devices, emphasizing EPA (Entrustable Professional Activity) development applicable to medical education settings

learning_goals: Learners can design a CME program using Kern’s 6-step curriculum development model.
Learners can design competency-based medical education modules using the Entrustable Professional Activities (EPA) development framework.
Learners can apply mixed-method research methodologies to evaluate the effectiveness of CME programs for medical professionals.
Learners can demonstrate team-based project management skills in a PBL environment involving large learner groups.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
